author: sky.cactus
content: <@273808422753796097> So many strong feelings about the gas stipend.  I strongly believe that the 2300 default should be removed entirely.

author: sky.cactus
content: Default should be either `0`/error or all remaining gas.

author: sky.cactus
content: I have been lobbying for probably a couple years now at the dapp layer for people to *never* use the stipend and at the language layer (Solidity) to not have the easy path use the stipend.  I have failed in this endeavor almost entirely.  ğŸ˜¢

author: sky.cactus
content:
> just issuing a standardized log when eth is transferred?
This is only useful if it captures *all* mechanisms for receiving ETH, including selfdestruct and whatnot.  Without that, then no one will be able to trust that all ETH receipt is accounted for, so they'll likely not use it (just like no one uses smart contracts that log ETH receipt now).

author: sky.cactus
content: And by "no one" I of course mean "it is not a recommended strategy".

author: .vbuterin
content: yeah, one side benefit of this approach is that we can add the log both for regular sends and for selfdestruct

author: .vbuterin
content: So we finally cover all the bases

author: Deleted User
content: I definitely support having robust logging for ETH receipts. It has been one of the weaknesses of both Bitcoin (in lesser extent) and Ethereum that it is quite hard to do proper accounting (because in order to understand how much Eth has come into an account and from where, and why - one needs re-tracing with quite a lot of intelligence built in). That goes against "ETH is money" narrative. Because good money should be easy to count ğŸ™‚
